meanings.definition: Apollo: a Greek god of music, poetry, prophecy, and medicine.
meanings.sent1: In ancient stories, Apollos was known for his beautiful music and healing powers.
meanings.sent2: People in Greece used to pray to Apollos for inspiration in poetry.
meanings.sent3: The idea of Apollos playing music on Mount Olympus always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like the music of Apollos, soothing and enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The image of Apollos holding a lyre is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Apollo: a type of butterfly found in North America.
meanings.sent1: The colorful Apollos fluttered gracefully among the flowers.
meanings.sent2: Children love to chase Apollos in the meadow during summer.
meanings.sent3: Watching the Apollos dance in the sunlight is a delightful sight.
meanings.sent4: The Apollos seemed to carry messages from one flower to another.
meanings.sent5: The fragile wings of the Apollos shimmered in the morning light.

meanings.definition: Apollo: a type of spacecraft used in the Apollo space program.
meanings.sent1: The Apollos spacecraft carried astronauts to the moon.
meanings.sent2: Scientists worked hard to ensure the safety of the Apollos missions.
meanings.sent3: Imagine traveling to space in an Apollos spacecraft - what an adventure!
meanings.sent4: The Apollos spacecraft symbolized human achievement in space exploration.
meanings.sent5: The launch of the Apollos spacecraft was a momentous event in history.

meanings.sent1: Apollos was a kind and gentle man, loved by all who knew him.
meanings.sent2: The name Apollos has a strong and noble ring to it.
meanings.sent3: When Apollos walked into the room, everyone couldn't help but smile.
meanings.sent4: His parents chose the name Apollos hoping he would bring light into the world.
meanings.sent5: Apollos, with his name like that of a god, always stood out in a crowd.
